title: Acne
alt: A green figure smiles as the pimples are popped

title: At Arms Length
price: At 'Arm’s Length' illustrates how those who make their home beneath the sea are both mesmerizing and deadly. Like the ocean and its creatures within, beauty invites reverence while revealing only a shadow of its violent potential. To survive, we must avoid its direct, and captivating gaze. Safety is found only when we embrace admiration from afar, because to draw too close is to risk everything

title: Bantu
alt: A woman's head, hair divided evenly into knots of green hair

title: Bloom Through the Break
alt: A face split open with flowers blooming from within.
blurb: Pain blossoms into a garden that insists on being seen.
price: Pain blossoms into a garden that insists on being seen.

title: Expressions: Green Desire
alt: A portrait of a woman whose face is split between warm flush tones and cool green highlights, lips vivid and expressive. Her face tilts slightly, her lips are tented as she bites on a corner, eyes slitted features radiating longing, tension and emotional heat. The green backdrop enhances the charged vibrant atmosphere
blurb: Desire that grows wild and unashamed. She wants-openly, vividly, without apology. Green undertones coil under she skin, like something alive, reminder that longing is not a sin but a pulse
price: Desire that grows wild and unashamed. She wants-openly, vividly, without apology. Green undertones coil under she skin, like something alive, reminder that longing is not a sin but a pulse

title: Expressions: Purple Joy
alt: A close up portrait of a Black woman mid-laugh, head thrown back, mouth open wide, eyes closed in pure release. Thick textured curls frame her face as vibrant purple tones contour her features. Brushstrokes are bold and energetic, capturing movement, sounds and emotion at once
blurb: Joy that refuses to be small. She laughs like a storm breaking open the sky: loud, unrestrained, unshakable. This is the sound of surviving everything they tried to quiet. This joy is not polite, it's liberation
price: Joy that refuses to be small. She laughs like a storm breaking open the sky: loud, unrestrained, unshakable. This is the sound of surviving everything they tried to quiet. This joy is not polite, it's liberation

title: Expressions: Red Sorrow
alt: A portrait of a sorrowful figure emerging from a blazing red background. Her textured white curls halo her head. Streaks of blue tears mark her cheeks. Warm orange highlights carve her features giving the grief in her expression a glowing intensity
blurb: Sorrow burns hotter than anger. Unquieted grief radiates. Red wraps around her like a fire she cannot outrun. The tear that falls is evidence of the battle she fights
price: Sorrow burns hotter than anger. Unquieted grief radiates. Red wraps around her like a fire she cannot outrun. The tear that falls is evidence of the battle she fights

title: Expressions: Teal Pride
alt: A centered portrait bathed in cool teal hues. Her expression is steady, unblinking, confident. Thick strokes shape her lips and eyes, giving her a sculptured presence against the monochrome blue/teal background. A quiet strength radiates from the stillness
blurb: Pride doesn't need volume to be undeniable. She stands with her chin lifted and her gaze steady. She is a living reminder that womanhood is a universe of its own. She does not ask for space. She is the space.
price: Pride doesn't need volume to be undeniable. She stands with her chin lifted and her gaze steady. She is a living reminder that womanhood is a universe of its own. She does not ask for space. She is the space.

title: Expressions: Violet Adrift
alt: A woman's face is half submerged in shifting blue water beneath a violet sky. Bubbles escape from her lips, while her eyes lift upward toward the surface with uncertainty and a hushed plea. Purples and blues blend to create a dreamlike suspended world
blurb: She floats between breath and breaking. She is adrift in limbo- neither sinking into the water nor kicking to the surface. She is adrift in her own thoughts, she searches for a horizon only she can see.
price: She floats between breath and breaking. She is adrift in limbo- neither sinking into the water nor kicking to the surface. She is adrift in her own thoughts, she searches for a horizon only she can see.

alt: Unblinking woman stares. Her eye is a kaleidoscope of cosmic colors and stars
blurb: Starry eyed woman with kaleidoscope of colors in her eyes

title: Oasis
alt: A body formed as a cascading waterfall crowned with a bloom.
blurb: A body becomes the landscape—vacation as return to the elemental.
price: A body becomes the landscape—vacation as return to the elemental.

title: Pink Collar Fatigue
alt: A woman slumps forward under the fluorescent wash of soft pink light. Her posture is collapsed, shoulders heavy, body exhausted. Every line of her form shows a weary resignation
blurb: The color of softness becomes a cage. Pink- the polite mask of expectation- presses into her spine under she folds. This is the ache of being overworked, overlooked, and expected to smile through it. Fatigue becomes its own quiet rebellion
price: The color of softness becomes a cage. Pink- the polite mask of expectation- presses into her spine under she folds. This is the ache of being overworked, overlooked, and expected to smile through it. Fatigue becomes its own quiet rebellion

title: SapioSexual
alt: a brain with figures exploring excreted liquid
medium: acrylic paint on unfinished wood panel

title: Say Cheese
alt: A woman’s face. Wide smile, straight teeth, slitted eyes

title: Their Expectations
alt: A woman lays prone, held in place by metal shackles. She is surrounded by mirrors that reflect, distort, fragment and exaggerate her reflection. Each frame shows a different version- she is thinner, quieter, smaller, dimmer, none reflect her true self/who she wants to be. Her body real is trapped in the center, tense, aware and alone.
blurb: A lifetime of expectations that forever surround her. Every mirror lies, Every reflection demand she be something else. Softer, smaller, nicer, less. She is trapped in the center of who they want her to be. She is shackled and forced to observe who they want to be. She fights to break away and refuses the roles written for her. She reaches for herself. Even knowing herself and who she wants to be, can she really escape who they want her to be?
price: A lifetime of expectations that forever surround her. Every mirror lies, Every reflection demand she be something else. Softer, smaller, nicer, less. She is trapped in the center of who they want her to be. She is shackled and forced to observe who they want to be. She fights to break away and refuses the roles written for her. She reaches for herself. Even knowing herself and who she wants to be, can she really escape who they want her to be?

title: Yellow
alt: Brown woman surrounded by blooming sunflower

title: Blue In Pain
alt: A blue form crouches, one wing outstretched the other torn and bleeding

title: Boom
alt: A woman reclines as she watches a nuclear explosion in the distance

title: Borderlands of Hypnagogia
price: The 'Borderlands of Hypnagogia' captures the disorienting, fluid space we all cross between wakefulness and sleep. The woman's face is split between the sharp clarity of day and the clarity it brings, and the vast velvety darkness of the subconscious. A stream of fluid dreams pours from her mouth, an exhalation of everything the waking body rejects. Her eyes are alert, yet drifting, suspended in that fragile state where thoughts melt into visions, and the hard edges of reality begin to soften. The piece captures the exact moment the mind loosens its grip and surrenders to the formless, welcoming pull of dream.

title: Burden of Many Faces
alt: A headless woman carrying multiple heads; masks slipping, identities exposed.
blurb: She shoulders the weight of her many selves. Each face is a shield, each mask a silence. The illusion fractures under the immense pressure. The masks slip and she stands exposed, unguarded, naked
price: She shoulders the weight of her many selves. Each face is a shield, each mask a silence. The illusion fractures under the immense pressure. The masks slip and she stands exposed, unguarded, naked

title: Crowned by Death
alt: Profile with red, white, and blue curls; a hooded shadow behind.
blurb: Her wild curls, streaked in red, white and blue are a glorious crown and a ghastly shroud. She ignores the hooded shadow- the silent witness. Though consumed by the drapings of this country, she stands proud, shoulders back head high, unbowed.
price: Her wild curls, streaked in red, white and blue are a glorious crown and a ghastly shroud. She ignores the hooded shadow- the silent witness. Though consumed by the drapings of this country, she stands proud, shoulders back head high, unbowed.

title: Dance puppet
alt: a female puppet is forced to move by a giant hand
blurb: When we allow others to control us
price: When we allow others to control us

title: Distraught
alt: A woman perches on her toes, spine bent she is folded in on herself. She is drenched in rain and tears fall from her eyes indistinguishable from the water falling from the sky

title: Drenched in Silence
alt: A curled figure drenched in rain; tears merge with water.
blurb: Folded in on herself, she is drenched so deep in sorrow tears and rain are indistinguishable. Vulnerability drips across her form, but there is strength in the stillness. This painting reflects grief that does not scream yet reshapes the body it inhabits.
price: Folded in on herself, she is drenched so deep in sorrow tears and rain are indistinguishable. Vulnerability drips across her form, but there is strength in the stillness. This painting reflects grief that does not scream yet reshapes the body it inhabits.

title: Heart Attack
alt: Hands grip a beating heart, they pull ripping the heart in two
blurb: With little concern for her, he ripped her heart in two

title: I Bleed
alt: A woman kneels screaming, wounds are on her arms, the liquid that spills becomes the background of red, black and green

title: Imposter Syndrome
alt: a woman sits on a stool, head bowed, naked

title: Migraine
blurb: She splits herself wide, tearing away the pieces that bind. From the wounds blooms force their way through. The blooms are vivid, unyielding, each petal is beauty and strength. Pain blossoms into a garden that insists on being seen.
price: She splits herself wide, tearing away the pieces that bind. From the wounds blooms force their way through. The blooms are vivid, unyielding, each petal is beauty and strength. Pain blossoms into a garden that insists on being seen.

title: My Body
alt: a blue figure with a hand displaying a middle finger overlayed
medium: acrylic paint on unfinished wood panel

title: Scrutiny
price: 'Scrutiny' shines a light on whether it is better to be seen or to remain invisible.  Under the harsh gaze of observers, our spines bow, our heads hang low, and we are silenced. Visibility becomes punishment, a pressure that warps both body and identity. We wither, we break, we shrink, decaying into a mere shadow of our potential. Who are we when we are shaped and molded by the gaze of others?

title: Shackled in Depths
alt: A figure reaching upward as water closes in; a struggle to rise.
blurb: She fights her demons. A flailing hand breaks the surface, twisting capture into resistance. Drowning becomes survival. Defiance is survival even under the weight of herstory  and her future

title: She dons her Armor
alt: A woman steps inside a form, the form is a giant wolf

title: Silenced Patriot
alt: Stripes forced between lips; eyes steady and bright.
blurb: The stars and stripes are used to bind and gag her. Her tears escape unnoticed, but her eyes burn with fire. Silence is its own violence and she endures its weight
price: The stars and stripes are used to bind and gag her. Her tears escape unnoticed, but her eyes burn with fire. Silence is its own violence and she endures its weight

title: Stolen Autonomy
alt: A set of bars set into a pair of full purple painted lips. A caged mouth. A single brown finger presses against them in a shy gesture. Within the mouth behind the bars, two hands tightly grip the bars.
blurb: Silence isn't always chosen. This is the hush demanded of us. They silence our lips with laws, and words and policies. We're told to be quiet, be polite, be nice, don't make a scene. What happens when we break free?
price: Silence isn't always chosen. This is the hush demanded of us. They silence our lips with laws, and words and policies. We're told to be quiet, be polite, be nice, don't make a scene. What happens when we break free?

title: Strings of Control
alt: A giant hand presses a figure downward; motion restrained.
blurb: Unshelved, paralyzed, limp- she falls. She tumbles into the depths as an unnatural force sustains her descent. With each passing moment, her voice, her agency and her strength peel away. In the end she is a shell of herself, a puppet with her strings cut.
price: Unshelved, paralyzed, limp- she falls. She tumbles into the depths as an unnatural force sustains her descent. With each passing moment, her voice, her agency and her strength peel away. In the end she is a shell of herself, a puppet with her strings cut.

title: To the Gods
alt: a woman crouches hands outstretched pleading to unseen gods

title: Trapped
alt: A tense nude figure crouches, her body is illuminated by a harsh yellow beam, that splits the void black background. The light highlights her muscles and emphasize the strain and desperation as she tries to escape. One hand bangs and the other hand presses against an unseen barrier, she is desperate to escape her confinement
blurb: Trapped between who she is and who the world demands she be. Her body strains toward the light but every muscle remembers the weight of captivity. Survival in its most raw form.
price: Trapped between who she is and who the world demands she be. Her body strains toward the light but every muscle remembers the weight of captivity. Survival in its most raw form.

title: You'd Be Prettier if You Just Smiled
